subject: Plantation along completed stretches
text: HRay 77ly TTHrf  gfetarut THV / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (aem Ma67 3 <TTHTt TT4) T48 Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 A1 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 4-5 & 6, A4er-10, ERro1, 7$ fraf-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka_ New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: 07.10.2014 Policy Matters: Technical (166/2014 (Decision taken on File No. 11013/1/2k/Env) It has been observed that the field offices of NHAI are not monitoring the progress of plantations along the highways. Occasionally, communications have been received from general public on the lack of commitment on the part of NHAI in ensuring plantations along completed stretches 2. In addition to the instructions issued in this from time to time, it is hereby directed that all the Regional Officers will monitor progress of plantations along highways under their jurisdiction on monthly basis 3 The following different types of arrangements exist, with respect to raising and maintaining roadside plantations: 1. Plantations done by Forest Department   along   highway as a statutory condition. ii. Plantations done through the Forest Department as deposit work: iii. Plantation in the scope of work of Concessionaire _ iv. Plantation in the scope of work of OMT Contractor Plantation done through other agencies (NGOs, Govt departments agencies other than Forest Department, communities, etc) _ 4 In case of PPP projects, the following protocol will be followed for monitoring of Plantations: 1_ The IE will   monitor progress of planting   and status of plantations on fortnightly basis ii. The IE will submit monitoring report to the concerned PIU by 18th and 3rd date of every month; for the preceding fortnight (i.e-, Ist to 15th and 16th to the last of every month; respectively) , in excel format. The report of IE shall be on the project specific website. iii. The PIUs will compile and report   project-wise monthly status to the concerned RO by 7th date of every month, in excel format: 5 . In case of 'public funded projects, the PIUs will monitor the status, and send monthly report to the respective RO_ 6_ The ROs will, henceforth, submit a monthly monitoring report on status of plantations by IOth of every month in the enclosed formats, through e-mail, to the concerned CGM at the HQs, in excel format The concerned CGMs will examine the reports and forward a verified copy for inclusion in the monitoring database.
